pr_title: Add config for orc compression codec

timeline.message:
Add config for orc compression codec

Adding a configuration to handle compression codec for handling orc
and dwrf storage format. Use hive.orc_compression_codec to override
the generic compression codec for orc and dwrf storage format. The
reason to add an extra configuration was the unavailability of uniform
support of all compression codec across all storage formats. The ZSTD
compression codec is only available for orc and dwrf storage format.

timeline.author: highker

timeline.bodyText: What other storage format cannot have zstd?
timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText: Anything other than ORC and DWRF.
replies.author: jainxrohit

timeline.author: bhhari

replies.bodyText: @bhhari I don't have a strong preference on equals vs == for enums, even though both do the same job. I find equals method less distracting as its the one gets used for other types. Let me know if you have strong preference.
replies.author: jainxrohit

replies.bodyText: @jainxrohit I think this should use == as other places in that file use that.
replies.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: Ah, make sense, I will change it.
replies.author: jainxrohit

timeline.bodyText: I'm curious, why do we still set the default codec to be gzip for orc? As I saw from the note, ZSTD is better than GZIP in both compression ratio and CPU.
timeline.author: yingsu00

replies.bodyText: @yingsu00 The plan is to roll out this change cluster by cluster. Thats why a config has been added in this PR.
replies.author: jainxrohit

timeline.bodyText: nit: drop @return actualStorageFormat - it doesn't add any information
timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: nit: perhaps,  shorten to Use  {@link #getActualStorageFormat()}; @deprecated annotation already says "This field is deprecated"
timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: nit: perhaps, shorten to Use {@link #getActualStorageFormat()}; @deprecated annotation already says "This field is deprecated"
timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText:
For the purpose of checking compatibility between StorageFormat and HiveCompressionCodec, you can use HiveCompressionCodec::isSupportedStorageFormat


For the purpose of getting ORC specific compression method,  you can use HiveCompressionCodec::orcCompressionKind


I didn't quite understand why existing hive.compression-codec is not good enough.
timeline.author: viczhang861

replies.author: jainxrohit

replies.bodyText:
I see, another way to do this is to add a default compression codec into HiveStorageFomat, to avoid configuring all combinations between storage format and compression.
Just curious,  what are other storage formats in production that rely on hive.compression-codec  ?
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText:
hive.compression-codec is used to configure compression for all storage format. I am not sure how many clients are using this config.
Hardcoding default in the HiveStorageFormat would not be flexible. Using the configurations we can rollout the change as we need.
replies.author: jainxrohit
